post.description: This API clones the files attached to a thread.

get.description:
This API gets the headers of a specific mail thread (a conversation received via the Mail Channel) associated with a ticket. The headers include metadata such as Date, From, To, CC, Subject, Message-ID, and more.

_Note_:
This API is only applicable to threads received via the Mail Channel and does not support other channels.

patch.description: This API updates a draft thread created via the @EMAIL@, @FACEBOOK@, or @FORUM@ channel.

get.description: This API get the orginal mail content including mail headers

post.description: This API sends an email reply. The from address in the email must be a from address configured in your help desk portal.
This API drafts an email reply. The from address in the email must be a from address configured in your help desk portal.

get.description: This API fetches threads for the specified viewId.
This API lists all threads in your helpdesk.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Index number, starting from which the threads must be fetched

schema.description: Index number, starting from which the threads must be fetched

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Key that sorts the threads by sendDateTime.
If the value of sortBy key is:
  • "sendDateTime" - sorting will be done in ascending order
  • "-sendDateTime " - (prefix the value with a "-") sorting will be done in descending order

Note: If this sortBy key is not specified, the sorting will be done in descending order by default based on sendDateTime.

schema.description:
Key that sorts the threads by sendDateTime.
If the value of sortBy key is:
  • "sendDateTime" - sorting will be done in ascending order
  • "-sendDateTime " - (prefix the value with a "-") sorting will be done in descending order

Note: If this sortBy key is not specified, the sorting will be done in descending order by default based on sendDateTime.

get.description: This API fetches a single thread from your help desk portal.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Content of the thread in plain text format. Value allowed is plainText.

schema.description: Content of the thread in plain text format. Value allowed is plainText.

get.description: This API lists a particular number of threads and comments recorded on a ticket, based on the limit specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Starting index from which the conversations should be fetched.

schema.description: Starting index from which the conversations should be fetched.

delete.description: This API deletes an attachment from a draft thread.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: ID of the attachment to be deleted

schema.description: ID of the attachment to be deleted

x-custom-parameters-attributes.descrption: The starting index for fetching conversation records

channel.description: Channel through which the thread originated. Values supported are @FACEBOOK@, @TWITTER@, @EMAIL@ and @FORUMS@ .

ticketStatus.description: Status of the ticket. Includes the custom statuses configured in your help desk portal.

to.description: To email ID in the thread, applicable only for @EMAIL@ channel

fromEmailAddress.description: Mandatory parameter for creating an email thread. Applicable for @EMAIL@, @ONLINE_CHAT@, @OFFLINE_CHAT@, @CUSTOMERPORTAL@, and @FORUMS@ channels.

contentType.description: Formatting type of the content. Applicable only for the @EMAIL@ channel. Values supported are @html@ and @plainText@ (default).

isForward.description: Key that returns if the thread was sent as a forward. Applicable only for the @EMAIL@ channel.

respondedIn.description: Time taken by the agent to respond to the customer

x-custom-parameters-attributes.descrption: Summary of the thread
Key that denotes if the thread is the description of the ticket
Specifies whether replies can be added be added to this thread.

Content of the thread

States whether the thread has attachments
Time of creating the thread
ID of the thread
Status of the thread.Values supported are @SUCCESS@,@PENDING@,@FAILED@,@DRAFT@
Key that returns whether the thread is incoming or outgoing

data.summary: Hello Welcome to Zoho Desks new Unified Ticket Screen. Here, you have complete context of the ticket. Now that you had received your first ticket, did you notice that it has been a...

value.content:
Hello

Welcome to Zoho Desks new Unified Ticket Screen. Here, you have complete context of the ticket. Now that you had received your first ticket, did you notice that it has been assigned to you? To respond to this ticket smartly, check out the Auto-Suggested Solutions in the pane to your left.

When you're done composing your response, you may send it and close the ticket.

Whatever action you perform, be rest assured that you can always track them under the ticket's history. With that, you're one step closer to delivering top-notch customer service!

Cheers,
Team Zoho Desk
1 888 900 9646
